port-used-by-connection: This port is used by the '{{connection}}' connection
current-user-is-readonly: The current user doesn't have permission to change Keenetic settings.
current-user-has-no-password: No password has been set for the current user. You can set it on the '{{administratorLinkOpen}}{{pageTitle}}{{administratorLinkClose}}' page.
access-point-is-used to connect-to-the-d: You will lose communication with the Keenetic if disable the wireless network
access-point-used-to-connect-to-the-devi: You will lose communication with the Keenetic if change {{ssid}} wireless network
connection-will-be-lost-due-to-a-dfs-che: You will lose communication with the Keenetic during the DFS check.
segment-used-to-access-the-device-dhcp-s: You will lose communication with the Keenetic if change IP settings
confirm-cancelling-changes:
Settings not saved.
Do you want to leave the page without saving the settings?
switchport-is-used-to-connect-to-the-dev: You will lose communication with the Keenetic if change settings of the port to which you are currently connected

wifi.description: Here you can configure Wi-Fi networks

errors.port-used-by-service: The port is already used by the '{{service}}' service

errors.ipv6-or-domain-required: Enter IPv6 address or domain name

errors.is-host: This is the IP address of the subnet

errors.reserved-ipv6: IPv6 address from a reserved block
errors.reserved-ipv6-prefix: IPv6 prefix from a reserved block

errors.not-in-nets: IP address is in conflict with the existing connection
errors.not-in-nets-named: IP address is in conflict with the '{{connection}}'
errors.host-ip-equals-gateway-ip: The IP address must not match the gateway address

errors.status-problem: Check that the data were entered correctly

ports.notInKbRange: Must be a number from 64 to 1000000

errors.transfercode-format: Enter the code in the following format: klmn:opqr:stuv:wxyz

hints.permanent-ip-description: Address will be assigned the next time you connect the client
hints.serverAddress: Specify an IP address. For a client IP to change to saved address, please reconnect the client to the network.
hints.ap-will-be-deleted-from: The selected network will be deleted from the segment

ndw4-feature-popup.title: Welcome to the beta release of our revamped Web Interface!
ndw4-feature-popup.description: The dashboard is now fully customisable. Select the tiles you need and arrange them in the order you prefer. General settings are accessible from the top right corner. Enjoy!

page-under-construction: This page is undergoing development and will become ready soon.

interface-state.ip_conflict: IP address conflict with the '{{interface}}' interface ({{subnet}})

ip-status.ip_conflict: IP address conflict with the '{{interface}}' interface ({{subnet}})

pending.fail-ipv4-conflict-extended: IP address conflict with the '{{interface}}' interface ({{subnet}})
pending.wifi-hwstate-off: Wi-Fi is disabled using a hardware button

ppp-interface-state.ip_conflict: IP address conflict with the '{{interface}}' interface ({{subnet}})

notifications.toggle-failed-ip-conflict-error: Failed to enable {{interfaceName}} due to an IP conflict with {{conflictingInterfaceName}}

session-timed-out-alert: The authentication session has expired. Please log in again.

layout.on-close-alert:
Keenetic router setup is not complete.

You cannot return to the Initial Setup Wizard but all the functions and settings of your Keenetic are available for manual configuration via the web interface.

search-link.title: Initial Setup Wizard
search-link.description: Initial Setup Wizard is a step-by-step helper in setting up the Internet connection, suitable for most available ISPs.

initial.description: This Device has a custom configuration. The Wizard will restore the device to factory settings with any custom settings being lost. Please confirm to continue.

reset-in-progress.header: Wait for Your Keenetic to Restart
reset-in-progress.description: The Initial Setup Wizard will resume automatically. However, if you are connecting by Wi-Fi, you may need to reconnect. After the Keenetic device restarts, wait until both the Status LED {{statusLed}} and the Wi-Fi LED {{wifiLed}} are illuminated and not blinking and then reconnect to Keenetic’s Wi-Fi network and resume the setup process.

reset.description: After rebooting, the Initial Setup Wizard will start. Please do not close the page.
reset.question: This Device has a custom configuration. The Wizard will restore the device to factory settings with any custom settings being lost. Please confirm to continue.
reset.warning:
After rebooting the device, please reconnect to this Wi-Fi network:
{{ssid}}

welcome.title: Welcome to the Initial Setup Wizard

select.label: Detected automatically
select.description: This choice will be set in your browser

select-configuration-option.title: Select the Desired Installation Scenario
select-configuration-option.description: Please select a use for this Keenetic device:

buddy.description: Please select a use for this Keenetic Wi-Fi Range Extender:

via-ethernet.label: To set up Internet access via an Ethernet cable supplied directly by your ISP
via-ethernet.description: Internet access via a modem, optical terminal or ethernet wall outlet

via-ethernet-modem.label: To set up Internet access via an external fibre optic, cable, satellite or DSL modem

via-sfp.label: To set up Internet access via an SFP module for a fibre optic connection
via-sfp.description: Internet access via a modem, optical terminal or ethernet wall outlet

via-mobile-network.label: To set up Internet access via a mobile broadband network
via-mobile-network.description: Internet access via mobile broadband network

via-usb-modem.label: To set up Internet access via mobile broadband USB modem
via-usb-modem.description: Internet access via external mobile broadband USB modem

via-dsl.label: To set up Internet access via a DSL line/telephone wall outlet
via-dsl.description: Internet access via VDSL/ADSL wall outlet

restore-configuration.label: To install with previously saved settings (Restore from file)
restore-configuration.description: Boot with the configuration that was stored in a file

setup-extender.label: To set up your device in Wi-Fi Extender Mode; or
setup-extender.description: Set up your device in Wi-Fi Extender Mode

setup-buddy-extender.label: To extend your existing Wi-Fi network, regardless of router brand (Extender role)

setup-buddy-mesh.label: To extend your existing Keenetic Mesh Wi-Fi System (Mesh Extender role)

setup-buddy-bridge.label: To connect a wired client device to your existing Wi-Fi network (Bridge role)

setup-buddy-access-point.label: To set up a new Wi-Fi network (Access Point role)

switch-to-extender.label: To switch to Wi-Fi Range Extender Mode
switch-to-extender.description: Switch this device to Extender Mode to further add it to your Wi-Fi System

switch-to-router.label: To switch to Wi-Fi Router Mode; or
switch-to-router.description: Switch this device to Router Mode

terms-and-privacy.title: Accept the End User License Agreement
terms-and-privacy.checkbox-text: By checking this box, I confirm that I have read and agree to the terms of the End User Licence Agreement.

device-privacy-notice.title: Accept the Device Privacy Notice
device-privacy-notice.checkbox-text: By checking this box, I confirm that I have read and agree to the terms of the Device Privacy Notice.

create-password.title: Create an Administrator Password
create-password.description: Please create a password below that will allow you to manage your Keenetic Router’s settings in the future. Please note that this administrative password shouldn't be the same as your Wi-Fi password and should be secure enough.
create-password.hint: The next time you manage this Keenetic device, use the username admin and the Administrator Password you created. Usernames and passwords are case-sensitive.

buddy.description: Please create a password below that will allow you to manage your Keenetic Extender’s settings in the future. Please note that this Administrator Password shouldn't be the same as your Wi-Fi Password and should be secure enough.

upload-configuration.title: Select the Configuration File to Restore
upload-configuration.description: To restore the settings on your Keenetic device, locate and select one of your previously saved backup files and click Confirm Choice to continue.
upload-configuration.configuration-looks-invalid: This file does not contain a valid configuration for your Keenetic device.

buddy.description: To restore the settings on your Keenetic Extender, locate and select one of your previously saved backup files and click Confirm Choice to continue.

wait-for-restart.title: Wait for your Keenetic Extender to Restart
wait-for-restart.description:
Please stand by while your Keenetic Extender reboots and returns to operation with the configuration that you have specified.

The Wi-Fi network called Keenetic_Extender_Setup should disappear after the reboot. If this network is still visible after the reboot, this may indicate that something went wrong in the process.
In this case, reconnect to the Keenetic_Extender_Setup Wi-Fi network and the Initial Setup Wizard will guide you through the next steps.

switch-to-extender.title: Switching to Extender Operating Mode
switch-to-extender.description: Follow the instructions to set up your Keenetic as a Wi-Fi System extender.
switch-to-extender.software-switch-info: Click 'Switch' to change the operating mode of your Keenetic to 'Extender'.
switch-to-extender.hardware-switch-info: Manually switch the device to Extender Mode. Set the selector switch to position 'B'.
switch-to-extender.rebooted-label: The operating mode has been successfully changed to 'Extender'.
switch-to-extender.after-switch-info:
After changing the operating mode, the web interface of your Keenetic will be available at a new IP address:

  • When connecting to your home network this address is set by the main Keenetic router, and shown on its web interface;
  • When disconnected from your home network, you must use the temporary IP address: 192.168.1.3. Before you can access this temporary IP you must set your computer IP address somewhere between 192.168.1.4 and 192.168.1.254.
  • Please note that Keenetic has a separate independent configuration file for each operating mode. The administrator password is empty by default, and if set, it is saved independently for each mode.

lte-install-antennas.title: Install the Mobile Antennas
lte-install-antennas.description: Install the supplied removable mobile antennas, and position them as per the diagram.

lte-sim-card.title: Insert Your SIM Card
lte-sim-card.description: Insert a SIM card with the gold contacts facing down into the SIM card slot on the back of your Keenetic device until you hear a click. To obtain an activated SIM card, contact your mobile broadband service provider.

lte-pin-code.title: Provide the SIM PIN Code
lte-pin-code.description: The SIM card installed requires a PIN code, please enter your four-digit PIN code in the field below. Please note, you have three attempts to enter the correct code after which your SIM card will be blocked until a Personal Unlock Key (PUK), provided by your mobile operator, is entered.

sim-pin.last-pin-attempt-confirm: This is your last attempt to enter a valid PIN. The SIM card will be locked immediately when you enter an incorrect PIN code this time.
sim-pin.pin-attempts-left: {{num}} attempts left to enter the PIN code.

lte-network-connection.title: Mobile Broadband Network Connection
lte-network-connection.description: Your Keenetic is searching for your operator’s mobile broadband network matching the SIM card you installed. This might take several minutes.

lte-signal-level.title: You Are Connected to the Internet
lte-signal-level.description: Your mobile operator is {{operatorName}}, network type is {{networkType}}, signal strength is {{signalLevelLabel}}.
lte-signal-level.no-mobile-operator-description: Mobile connection established, signal strength is {{signalLevelLabel}}.
lte-signal-level.hint: For better results, you can try moving your Keenetic device to find a spot that receives a stronger mobile network signal.
lte-signal-level.color-legend: Note that the colour of the Internet LED {{internetLed}} on your Keenetic device indicates network type. The Base Station LED {{baseStationLed}} indicates signal strength.

lte-external-antenna.title: Optional External Antenna
lte-external-antenna.description: To extend your mobile broadband signal range you can purchase a third-party high-gain directional panel antenna. An external antenna can be connected to an SMA antenna connector similar to the attachment of the supplied mobile antenna.

lte-verify-operator.title: Verify Your Operator’s Parameters
lte-verify-operator.description:
Keenetic is unable to automatically connect to your mobile broadband network. Please verify with your operator that:
  • Your SIM card has not expired, and is data transmission-capable.
  • Mobile broadband service is enabled on your account.
  • Your Keenetic is located within your operator’s service area or that data roaming is enabled.
  • You have sufficient credit.
  • You have the correct parameters configured for this SIM card (e.g. APN/Username/Password to access the Internet).

lte-review-params.title: Review the Parameters and Retry
lte-review-params.description: Make the necessary changes per your mobile operator’s advice and then retry.

lte-double-check-sim.title: Double-Check the SIM Card
lte-double-check-sim.description:
Unfortunately, your Keenetic still cannot connect to your mobile broadband network. Please make sure you have correctly entered the settings as advised by your operator and double-check the SIM card’s validity and look for physical damage.

Try to insert the SIM card into another device to make sure it works, in the same location as your Keenetic device.

unplug-modem.title: Unplug Your Modem
unplug-modem.desc_begin: Disconnect your DSL / Fibre / Cable or Satellite modem from the power supply. If there is a backup battery, remove it. If you have other wireless equipment connected to your modem, please detach.
unplug-modem.desc_end: If you have no modem and your Internet connection is through a direct Ethernet cable and/or your Internet connection involves VLAN settings, choose 'I have no modem'.

connect-modem.title: Connect Your Modem to Your Keenetic

description.blue-port: Position your Keenetic device near your Internet-connected modem (place your Keenetic in an open area for better wireless coverage). Using an Ethernet cable (generally, one is supplied with a modem) connect the modem to the blue port marked {{port}} on your Keenetic device.
description.grey-port: Position your Keenetic device near your Internet-connected modem (place your Keenetic in an open area for better wireless coverage). Using an Ethernet cable (generally, one is supplied with a modem) connect the modem to the grey port marked {{port}} on your Keenetic device.
description.red-port: Position your Keenetic device near your Internet-connected modem (place your Keenetic in an open area for better wireless coverage). Using an Ethernet cable (generally, one is supplied with a modem) connect the modem to the red port marked {{port}} on your Keenetic device.

wan-via-sfp.title: Plug an SFP Transceiver Into Your Keenetic
wan-via-sfp.description: Connect the fibre optic cable from your ISP to the SFP transceiver. Insert the SFP transceiver into an SFP slot on your Keenetic. For the list of known compatible SFP transceivers, please visit {{supportSite}}. Consult your Internet Service Provider to make sure that your line is ready and that the service is available.

wan-via-modem.title: Power Up Your Modem
wan-via-modem.description: Plug your modem back into a power outlet (if a backup battery was removed, reconnect it now) and then wait for about two minutes for the modem to restart.

wan-via-wall-outlet.title: Connect Your Keenetic to an Ethernet Outlet

description.blue-port: Connect the cable to the blue port marked {{port}} on your Keenetic device. Consult your Internet Service Provider to make sure that your line is ready and that the service is available.
description.grey-port: Connect the cable to the grey port marked {{port}} on your Keenetic device. Consult your Internet Service Provider to make sure that your line is ready and that the service is available.
description.red-port: Connect the cable to the red port marked {{port}} on your Keenetic device. Consult your Internet Service Provider to make sure that your line is ready and that the service is available.

tv-option.title: Select your Streaming Media Service Option

off-the-shelf-tv.title: Off the shelf Smart TV or media player (Recommended)
off-the-shelf-tv.description: Choose this option if you are using a Smart TV, Apple TV or Android TV media players available off the shelf to watch TV & Movies online, or you plan to connect them in the future.

operator-stb.title: Operator-branded IPTV STB with custom setup instructions
operator-stb.description: Choose this option if you have an operator-branded set-top box (STB). To set up this type of TV connection you need to follow the instructions from your operator.

vlan-setup.title: Enter VLAN Information
vlan-setup.description: In addition to the Internet service, many operators provide a multicast IPTV service with operator-branded set-top box (STB) devices. In order for such a service to work, your new Keenetic device must be properly configured. Check with your Internet Service Provider if it is necessary to configure any VLAN numbers for the Internet or IPTV services in your Keenetic device. If not, proceed without VLAN numbers.

vlan-information.title: Enter VLAN Information
vlan-information.description: Check with your Internet Service Provider if it is necessary to configure a VLAN number for the Internet in your Keenetic device. If not, proceed without VLAN number.

ip-conflict.title: Wait for Your Keenetic to Restart
ip-conflict.new-ip-message: Your Keenetic device has detected an IP address conflict with your Internet Service Provider. Your Keenetic device will restart and the IP address will be updated to {{ip}} to avoid this conflict.
ip-conflict.description: The Initial Setup Wizard will resume automatically. However, if you are connecting by Wi-Fi, you may need to reconnect. After the Keenetic device restarts, wait until both the Status LED {{statusLed}} and the Wi-Fi LED {{wifiLed}} are illuminated and not blinking and then reconnect to Keenetic’s Wi-Fi network and resume the setup process.

connection-type.title: Select Your Internet Connection Type
connection-type.description: Please specify the type of your Internet connection as follows, for the automatic default Internet access configuration method did not succeed.

type-description.dhcp: Choose this option if your Internet Service Provider did not provide any connection details. Most connections directly from an Ethernet Wall Outlet and Cable modems use this type of connection.
type-description.pppoe: Choose this option if your Internet connection requires Username and Password to get online. Most DSL modems use this type of connection.
type-description.pptp-l2tp: Choose this option if your Internet connection requires Username, Password and Server Address to get online. Some connections directly from an Ethernet Wall Outlet use this type of connection.
type-description.static-ip: Choose this option if your Internet Service Provider provided you with IP Address information that has to be manually entered.

mac-address.title: Choose Which MAC Address to Use
mac-address.description: A MAC address is a unique hardware identification number that lists each device on a network. Some Internet Service Providers use MAC addresses to identify or authenticate your Internet connection. So changing the MAC address of your new Keenetic device to the MAC address of your old router could be a quicker fix than telling your ISP to register the MAC of your new Keenetic device.

manual.label: Substitute with
manual.subtext: Enter the MAC address specified in the contract with your ISP or the MAC address of a previous router.
manual.description: Required if a different device is registered with the ISP

clone.label: Clone from this device
clone.description: May be required if the MAC address of your computer is registered with the ISP

pppoe.title: Enter Your Credentials
pppoe.description: To setup PPPoE Internet connection type you need to know your Username and Password from your Internet Service Provider (ISP). If you do not have this information, please contact your ISP.

pptp-l2tp.title: Enter Your Credentials
pptp-l2tp.description: To setup the PPTP or L2TP Internet connection type, you need to know your Username, Password, and Authentication Server Address from your Internet Service Provider (ISP). If you do not have this information, please contact your ISP.

import-pppoe-settings.title: Import PPPoE connection settings
import-pppoe-settings.description: Connect the WAN port of the previous router to the indicated port {{port}}, and power it up; your Keenetic will configure the ISP connection according to the gathered information.

status.connect-to-port: Please connect the WAN port of the previous router to the specified port

ip-config.title: Enter Your IP Address Information
ip-config.description: To setup Static IP address connection type you need to have a complete list of IP information from your Internet Service Provider. If you have a Static IP connection but any of this information is missing, please contact your ISP.

manual.label: Substitute with
manual.subtext: Enter the MAC address specified in the contract with your ISP or the MAC address of a previous router.
manual.description: Required if a different device is registered with the ISP

clone.label: Clone from this device
clone.description: May be required if the MAC address of your computer is registered with the ISP.

internet-connection-check.title: Internet Connection Check
internet-connection-check.description: Your Keenetic device is now configured for Internet access using the settings you provided. Keenetic is trying to connect to the Internet now. This process might take several minutes.

double-check-credentials.title: Double-Check Your Credentials
double-check-credentials.description: Your Keenetic device has detected a problem, please check the documentation provided by your ISP, ensuring that your Username and Password for Internet access as entered are correct. If you no longer have this information you can contact your ISP and they'll be able to assist you. Please note: Keenetic support doesn't have access to these credentials, and the Username and Password asked for in this section are different to the ones used to log into your Keenetic Web Interface.

review-isp-settings.title: Review Your Settings With Your ISP
review-isp-settings.description: Your Keenetic was unable to connect to the Internet. Below is the summary of your Internet access settings. Please review the settings to make sure that you have selected and entered the correct options. You can also contact your Internet Service Provider (ISP) to check the configuration information.

select-country-or-region.title: Select Your Country or Region
select-country-or-region.description: Please confirm the country of operation and the applicable time zone.

auto-update.title: Allow Automatic Updates
auto-update.description: To keep your network up to date, we recommend that you enable automatic operating system updates on a weekly schedule that suits you. Keenetic's dual operating system image hardware design ensures failsafe updates that take less than a minute to complete, followed by a brief Internet interruption for a system reboot. Setting up the schedule follows in the next step.
auto-update.latest-os-already-installed-with-date: Your Keenetic {{model}} is up to date and running the latest KeeneticOS version {{osVersion}}, dated {{osReleaseDate}}.
auto-update.latest-os-already-installed: Your Keenetic {{model}} is up to date and running the latest KeeneticOS version {{osVersion}}.
auto-update.latest-os-release-notes: Learn more about the latest features, security and performance enhancements.
auto-update.os-update-available-with-date: KeeneticOS version {{osVersion}} dated {{osReleaseDate}}, is available for your Keenetic {{model}}.
auto-update.os-update-available: KeeneticOS version {{osVersion}} is available for your Keenetic {{model}}.
auto-update.os-update-release-notes: Learn more about the latest features, security and performance enhancements.

auto-update-schedule.title: Select Preferred Times for Automatic Updates
auto-update-schedule.description: Please set a convenient schedule for automatic operating system updates. During the update, your Keenetic Extender will download the latest operating system and reboot immediately. You may experience 60 seconds of downtime while your Keenetic Extender reboots. If you have a Mesh Wi-Fi System, your Main Keenetic Router will automatically manage updates on all nodes of the Mesh Wi-Fi System.

updating-firmware.title: Updating Your Keenetic Device
updating-firmware.wait-while-updating-with-date:
When you set up your Keenetic device for the first time, it will run the version of KeeneticOS that was factory-loaded. We are constantly updating KeeneticOS for performance and security improvements to ensure that your network is completely up-to-date.
Your KeeneticOS is being updated to version {{osVersion}} dated {{osReleaseDate}}.
updating-firmware.wait-while-updating:
When you set up your Keenetic device for the first time, it will run the version of KeeneticOS that was factory-loaded. We are constantly updating KeeneticOS for performance and security improvements to ensure that your network is completely up-to-date.
Your KeeneticOS is being updated to version {{osVersion}}.

stage.os-update-failed: Update download failure. You may update later, via the Keenetic web interface.
stage.os-update-failed-autoupdate-enabled: Update download failure. KeeneticOS will automatically update later, as scheduled.

features.mws: Create a Mesh Wi-Fi System to improve your home's wireless coverage.

wifi-settings.title: Wi-Fi Network Settings
wifi-settings.description:
Every Keenetic device has a unique Wi-Fi network name and high-security level password set at the factory. This information is printed on the back label of your Keenetic. You can choose to keep or change these settings.

If you’re replacing an existing router, you may wish to reuse the network name and password from your former equipment, so you will not have to reconnect devices that were previously connected to your network.
wifi-settings.description-reconnect: Please reconnect the Wi-Fi network to resume the setup process.

digital-certificates.title: Installing Trusted Digital Certificates
digital-certificates.description: For safe operation right out of the box, Keenetic deploys individual bank-grade digital encryption certificates to enable protected HTTPS connections to your device. You can continue the initial setup while your Keenetic device obtains a trusted certificate from the Let’s Encrypt certification authority in the background.
digital-certificates.success: From now on, whenever you access the Keenetic Web Interface, your connection will automatically be protected from eavesdropping and unauthorized access.
digital-certificates.failure: The certificate installation process is initiated. Your Keenetic will be obtaining a trusted certificate from the Let’s Encrypt certification authority. Please press 'Next'.

product-improvement.title: Join the Product Improvement Program
product-improvement.description:
Keenetic is committed to providing customers with the best possible user experience. We invite you to join our Product Improvement Program to help us build better products.

If you agree to participate, Keenetic device will collect and periodically send anonymous KeeneticOS usage and diagnostic data to help us improve your experience.

No information is collected that could be used to identify or contact you. You can opt out of this program at any time by accessing the System Settings on the Keenetic Web Interface.
product-improvement.dpn-link-text: See the Device Privacy Notice for more information.

verify-iptv.title: Verify IPTV Service Operation
verify-iptv.description: Connect your operator-branded set-top box (STB) to the port {{port}}, power it up and check if the IPTV service is available and operating correctly.
verify-iptv.description-alternate: Because the IPTV service was not available, alternative settings have been initiated in your Keenetic device. Please remove your set-top box (STB) from the power source for 10 seconds, then plug it in. Make sure your STB is connected to the port {{port}} and check if the IPTV service is available and operating correctly. If the IPTV service is still not operating correctly, contact your ISP for the necessary settings to manually configure the IPTV service on your Keenetic device. Manual configuration can be performed after completing the Initial Setup Wizard.
verify-iptv.description-mvr: Connect your operator-branded set-top box (STB) to the port {{port}}, power it up and check if the IPTV service is available and operating correctly. If the IPTV service is not operating correctly, contact your ISP for the necessary settings to manually configure the IPTV service on your Keenetic device. Manual configuration can be performed after completing the Initial Setup Wizard.
verify-iptv.description-no-free-port: Select a port on the device where you connect the operator-branded set-top box (STB). You can check if the IPTV service is available and operating correctly or skip the IPTV service test for now.

choices.success: IPTV service is available, STB operating correctly
choices.failure: IPTV service is not available or STB operating incorrectly
choices.failure-alternate: IPTV service is still not available or STB operating incorrectly
choices.skip: To skip the IPTV service test

verify-iptv.use-port: Please connect the STB device to the specified port

mobile-operator.title: Select Mobile Operator
mobile-operator.description: Please select the country and mobile broadband operator you are connecting to. In case you have the settings advised by your operator, select Other in the list and enter parameters manually.

dsl-provider.title: Select Your Internet Service Provider
dsl-provider.description: Please select the country and service provider to which you are connecting. In case you have specific settings provided by your service provider, select Other from the list.

ethernet-provider.title: Select Your Internet Service Provider
ethernet-provider.description: Please select the country and service provider to which you are connecting. In case you have specific settings provided by your service provider, select Other from the list.

your-keenetic-credentials.title: Store Your Keenetic Device Credentials
your-keenetic-credentials.description: Use one of the options below to create a copy of the following important data. This vital system information and configuration options will be useful for future reference.

web-interface.title: Web Interface
web-interface.get-buddy-ip-from-router: Open the user interface of the Main Router to determine the IP address assigned to your Keenetic Buddy.

internet-connection.title: Internet Connection

usb-plug-modem.title: Plug a USB Modem Into Your Keenetic
usb-plug-modem.description:
Insert the SIM card into your USB Modem. Make sure the SIM requires no PIN code. You can disable the requesting of a PIN code using a mobile phone, by temporarily installing the SIM card into the phone. Alternatively, you can connect the modem to a computer and use the modem utility to disable requesting of a PIN code.

Insert the USB Modem into a USB port on your Keenetic. The FN LED {{fnLed}} will illuminate if a compatible USB Modem is detected. For the list of known compatible USB modems, please visit {{supportSite}}. If the USB Modem you have is not listed, then you may contact us, and we will look into making it compatible!

usb-check-connection.title: Mobile Broadband Network Connection
usb-check-connection.description: Your Keenetic is searching for your operator’s mobile broadband network. This might take several minutes.

usb-double-check.title: Double-Check the Modem and SIM Card
usb-double-check.description: Unfortunately, your Keenetic still cannot connect to the mobile broadband network using the provided USB modem. Please make sure you have correctly entered the settings as advised by your operator, double-check the SIM card’s validity, and look for physical damage to the SIM. Try to insert the SIM card into another device to make sure it works, in the same location as your Keenetic device.

usb-internet-connect.title: You Are Connected to the Internet
usb-internet-connect.description: Your mobile operator is {{operatorName}}, signal strength is {{signalLevelLabel}}.
usb-internet-connect.no-operator-name-description: Mobile connection established, signal strength is {{signalLevelLabel}}.
usb-internet-connect.warning: For better results, you can later try moving your Keenetic near a window to avoid weakening of the network signal. You may use a small USB extension cable up to 1 meter long for connecting a USB modem to your Keenetic, to help find a spot that receives stronger mobile network signal.

usb-verify-operator.title: Verify Your Operator’s Parameters
usb-verify-operator.description:
Keenetic is unable to automatically connect to your mobile broadband network using the supplied USB modem. Please verify with your operator that:
  • Your SIM card has not expired, and is data transmission-capable.
  • Mobile broadband service is enabled on your account.
  • Your Keenetic is located within your operator’s service area.
  • You have sufficient credit.
  • You have the correct parameters configured for this SIM card.

dsl-provider-fields.dt-login: Fill in data provided by ISP

extender-without-switch-mode.title: Confirm Changing to Extender Mode
extender-without-switch-mode.description:
Keenetic routers deliver reliable, continuous and secure Wi-Fi throughout your home. Starting with one main Keenetic router, as your demands increase you can add more Keenetic devices to act as Wi-Fi extenders, creating a centrally-managed multi-node Mesh Wi-Fi System.

1. Your Keenetic device has two selectable operating modes - Router and Extender. If you are extending an existing network and this Keenetic device is to act as a Wi-Fi extender, click Next to proceed.

2. Wait for the Keenetic to restart. Check that both the Status LED {{statusLed}} and Wi-Fi LED {{wifiLed}} are illuminated and not blinking. Connect the Keenetic device you wish to be a Mesh Wi-Fi Extender to your Main Router using an Ethernet cable (as supplied). Make sure that both your Keenetic devices are now connected to a power source. Check that the Internet LED {{internetLed}} on the ‘Extender’ is illuminated and not blinking.

3. Reconnect this mobile device / computer to your Keenetic Main Router network via Wi-Fi or Ethernet cable to add an extender candidate to your Wi-Fi System.

4. Log in to the Main Router and open Wi-Fi System section. Find the extender candidate in the list, and click the Acquire button next to it.

5. A Keenetic Wi-Fi System will support both wireless and wired connections between the Main Router and Extenders to maximize network throughput and stability. After setup is complete, disconnect your Extender from the Main Router and place the Extender where you want in your home to expand your Wi-Fi network.

description.generic:
Keenetic routers deliver reliable, continuous and secure Wi-Fi throughout your home. Starting with one main Keenetic router, as your demands increase you can add more Keenetic devices to act as Wi-Fi extenders, creating a centrally-managed multi-node Mesh Wi-Fi System.

1. Set the A/B mode switch on the side of your Keenetic {{model}} to position B. Wait while the machine restarts. Check that both the Status LED {{statusLed}} and Wi-Fi LED {{wifiLed}} are illuminated and not blinking.

2. Connect the Keenetic device you wish to be a Mesh Wi-Fi Extender to your Keenetic Main Router using an Ethernet cable (as supplied). Make sure that both your Keenetic devices are now connected to a power source. Check that the Internet LED {{internetLed}} on the ‘Extender’ is illuminated and not blinking.

3. Reconnect this mobile device / computer to your Keenetic Main Router network via Wi-Fi or Ethernet cable to add an extender candidate to your Wi-Fi System.

4. Log in to the Main Router and open Wi-Fi System section. Find the extender candidate in the list, and click the Acquire button next to it.

5. A Keenetic Wi-Fi System will support both wireless and wired connections between the Main Router and Extenders to maximize network throughput and stability. After setup is complete, disconnect your Extender from the Main Router and place the Extender where you want in your home to expand your Wi-Fi network.,
description.pro-series:
Keenetic routers deliver reliable, continuous and secure Wi-Fi throughout your home or small office. Starting with one main Keenetic router, as your demands increase you can add more Keenetic devices to act as Wi-Fi extenders, creating a centrally-managed multi-node Mesh Wi-Fi System.

1. Set the A/B mode switch on the side of your Keenetic {{model}} to position B. Wait while the machine restarts. Check that the Status LED {{statusLed}} is illuminated and not blinking.

2. Connect the Keenetic device you wish to be a Mesh Wi-Fi Extender to your Keenetic Main Router using an Ethernet cable (as supplied). Make sure that both your Keenetic devices are now connected to a power source. Check that the Status LED {{statusLed}} on the ‘Extender’ is illuminated and not blinking.

3. Reconnect this mobile device / computer to your Keenetic Main Router network via Wi-Fi or Ethernet cable to add an extender candidate to your Wi-Fi System.

4. Log in to the Main Router and open Wi-Fi System section. Find the extender candidate in the list, and click the Acquire button next to it.

5. A Keenetic Wi-Fi System will support both wireless and wired connections between the Main Router and Extenders to maximize network throughput and stability. After setup is complete, disconnect your Extender from the Main Router and place the Extender where you want to expand your Wi-Fi network in your home or small office.

dsl-manual-setup.title: Set Up an Internet Connection
dsl-manual-setup.description: When your Internet service starts, your Internet Service Provider typically gives you all the information that you need to connect to the Internet. Enter the following information to connect to the Internet, or contact your service provider for assistance.

dsl-connect-to-phone-line.title: Connect Your Keenetic to a Phone Line
dsl-connect-to-phone-line.description: Make sure that your DSL service is active. Install the supplied DSL splitter between your phone line and your Keenetic. The LINE port on the DSL splitter must be connected to a phone outlet. Use the supplied phone cable and the TAE-to-RJ11 adapter if necessary. The MODEM port must be connected to the DSL port on your Keenetic device. A landline phone can be attached to the PHONE port on the DSL splitter if necessary.
dsl-connect-to-phone-line.hint: Please check if your phone cable is properly connected.

dsl-setup-iptv.title: Set Up an IPTV Service
dsl-setup-iptv.description: In addition to Internet service, many operators provide an IPTV service with operator-branded set-top box (STB) devices. In order for such service to work, your new Keenetic device must be properly configured. Check with your Internet Service Provider to configure any additional parameters for the IPTV service. This step is optional and you can configure IPTV service later if you prefer.

dsl-review-isp-settings.title: Review Your Settings With Your ISP
dsl-review-isp-settings.description: Your Keenetic was unable to connect to the Internet. Below is the summary of your Internet access settings. Please review the settings to make sure that you have selected and entered the correct options. You can also contact your Internet Service Provider (ISP) to check the configuration information.

select-wan-port.title: Select the Ethernet Port for Internet Connection
select-wan-port.description: Please select an unoccupied Ethernet port for connecting an external fibre, cable, satellite or DSL modem, or an Ethernet cable supplied directly by your ISP. Do not connect the Ethernet cable to your selected port yet. You will be prompted to do this later.
select-wan-port.description-2_5G: Please select an Ethernet port for connecting an external fibre, cable, satellite or DSL modem, or an Ethernet cable supplied directly by your ISP. If your Internet connection is faster than 1 Gbit/s, select the red 2.5 Gbit/s port marked {{orangePort}}. In this case, the Wizard will reassign the blue port {{bluePort}} for use in a home network. Do not connect the Ethernet cable to your selected port yet. You will be prompted to do this later.
select-wan-port.switch-user-port-warning: Please select any grey Ethernet port to connect your computer to the Keenetic. The current port will be configured for Internet connection.

auth-fields.hint: Please type in your full user name and password, exactly as supplied by your service provider

extender.text-part-1:
Tip: Connect a wired-only device to your Keenetic Extender

Besides extending wireless coverage, you can use the Ethernet port on your Keenetic Extender for wired-only devices, such as desktop computers, media players, or game consoles, to connect to your wireless network.
extender.text-part-2: You can also leverage existing Ethernet wiring to connect an extender to your main router. This setup will ensure the best possible performance of your extended network.

Your {{model}} will also install the latest KeeneticOS version {{osVersion}}, dated {{osReleaseDate}}. Once the device has restarted, wait until the Wi-Fi LED {{wifiLed}} is solid green. Then unplug the Keenetic Extender and move it within range of your router. Connect your wired device to the Extender using an Ethernet cable.

select-network.title: Select the Keenetic Wi-Fi Network You Want to Extend
select-network.description: If you have multiple Wi-Fi networks in your home, for example, your Home or Guest networks, select your main Wi-Fi network, which is part of the Home segment on your Keenetic Router.
select-network.title-extender: Choose Your Existing Wi-Fi Network to Extend
select-network.description-extender-dual-band: For better performance, select a 5 GHz network whenever possible. If a wireless network is set to hide its network name, it will not appear in the list of available wireless networks. If this is the case, click I have a hidden SSID and enter the Wi-Fi network information manually.
select-network.description-extender-single-band: If a wireless network is set to conceal its network name, it does not appear in the list of available wireless networks. In this case, click ‘I have a hidden SSID’ and manually enter the Wi-Fi network information.

reconnect-to-main-router.title: Add Your New Keenetic Extender to Your Mesh Wi-Fi System

contents.part1: 1. Connect your mobile device/computer to your main Wi-Fi network called {{ssid}}.
contents.part2: 2. Start a web browser and go to my.keenetic.net. Log into your Keenetic Main Router with admin as username and the administrator password you created when configuring your main device. You will see the Main Router’s Web Interface.
contents.part3: 3. On the left toolbar, click on the MY NETWORKS AND WI-FI > Wi-Fi System menu item. You will see an overview of the Mesh Wi-Fi System and an invitation to acquire the newly detected Extender. Click Acquire and wait for the process to complete.
contents.end: You can also add your new Keenetic Extender to the Mesh Wi-Fi System using the Keenetic Mobile Application if you are already familiar with it.

You have enabled IGMP proxy mode which allows you to connect the IPTV STB to any port of the Keenetic.

0: Connect the IPTV STB using supplied cable to network port 2 of your Keenetic.
Connect your IPTV STB to the TV following the STB instruction.
Turn on the STB and TV.
Note the video input jack to which the IPTV STB is connected and use remote control to select correct input.
Use STB remote control to select a channel to check.

If the set-top box requires you to enter a PIN or activation code,
do it in accordance with the instructions of your IPTV provider.
1: Important! Reboot the STB, so it picks up the new settings.
Use STB remote control to select a channel to check.

Sign up and take your network management to the next level!

wifi-utilization.description: Constantly monitor the current status of the Wi-Fi channel used by your device for band utilization, and search for neighbouring networks on demand.
wifi-utilization.network-scan-hint: Network scanning can temporarily delay or interrupt data transmission with the device. Some clients might disconnect.
wifi-utilization.network-chart-description: A histogram collates the Wi-Fi channels with the number of networks that use them, outlining channels in use by the device. The table lists every identified network. You can select multiple channels or networks to filter the results.

wifi-analyzer.description: The dedicated spectrum analyser radio continuously scans all 5 GHz Wi-Fi channels and visualizes the level of interference from neighbouring networks to help with channel selection and planning. Channel utilization data depicts Wi-Fi signals received by the spectrum analyser radio and does not include Wi-Fi signals transmitted by this Keenetic device. The channel utilization colour designates the strength of the interference. Colder colours represent lower interference, and warmer colours represent higher interference in the frequency range.

application-traffic-analyzer.title: Application traffic analyser
application-traffic-analyzer.description: Track traffic of Internet applications used by network client devices in real time. The last three minutes' data is accumulated in the view.

hwnat-status.enabled: The system is set to optimize routing performance. In this mode, category and application traffic cannot be accounted accurately. Please note, changing mode resets the history for application and category traffic.
hwnat-status.disabled: The system is set for detailed category and application traffic accounting. Enable {{hwnatLinkOpen}}Hardware Network Accelerator{{hwnatLinkClose}} if maximum routing performance is required. Please note, changing mode resets the history for application and category traffic.

keendns.title: KeenDNS
keendns.description: KeenDNS service provides the domain name to your Keenetic, allowing you to connect to the web interface and servers on your network via the Internet.
keendns.setup-description:
Using Cloud access mode provides a remote connection to the device via HTTP/HTTPS-based protocols only. This mode will work even when your ISP issues your device a private (i.e., not accessible from the Internet) IP address.
Direct access mode allows employing the domain name to connect to the device via any protocol. The data transfer rate is limited only by the parameters of your ISP connection. Check with your ISP about the possibility of assigning your device a public IP address (otherwise, direct access mode will not work).

block1.title:
Keenetic
Mesh Wi-Fi Systems
block1.description: Forget about your old one-router <nobr>Wi-Fi</nobr> network. Linking any two, or more, Keenetic devices, will immediately create a multi-node network for your location. Increase and improve your home’s <nobr>Wi-Fi</nobr> coverage, streaming, downloading, and sharing without missing a beat from anywhere in your home.
block1.bottom-slogan: A multi-node Keenetic <nobr>Wi-Fi</nobr> system will ensure seamless roaming throughout your house whatever the size.

block2.title: Dead zone killer
block2.description: If you have <nobr>Wi-Fi</nobr> coverage problems a Keenetic Mesh <nobr>Wi-Fi System</nobr> can help. Unlike traditional routers, it uses multiple nodes to create a fast, secure and stable <nobr>Wi-Fi</nobr> network. Just add a <nobr>Wi-Fi</nobr> extender where you need it: your bedroom, kitchen, or even basement. Now you can get the maximum speed all over your house.

block3.title: What do I get?
block3.strong-signal:
High strength reliable signal
Wi-Fi extenders work together to create a connected system that gives you a strong signal throughout your home.
block3.lossless:
Lossless transmission
You can stream a movie on your phone whilst walking from room to room without any signal drops.
block3.fast-connection:
Fast connection
Because each Wi-Fi extender is a node with a high-fidelity signal, all of your clients get a fast connection.
block3.strong-security:
Strong security
Industry-leading hardware and cloud-based security that automatically updates itself means you’re always protected.

block4.title: Easy to set up and easy to use.
block4.description: Keenetic routers deliver reliable, continuous and secure <nobr>Wi-Fi</nobr> throughout your home. Starting from one main Keenetic router, as demand grows, you can add Keenetics as <nobr>Wi-Fi</nobr> extenders to grow from a single-node system to a centrally managed multi-node Mesh <nobr>Wi-Fi System</nobr>.
block4.time-to-setup: devices in the system is not the maximum!
block4.bottom-text: At Keenetic we hope we have thought of every possible option, we offer solutions from the user in the smallest apartment to the very largest home, for customers using the simplest straight out of the box wireless connection to clients demanding maximum speed  from more complex ethernet connected gigabit networks. With Keenetic there is no need for paid subscriptions or permanent cloud access.

block5.title: Why is a Keenetic Mesh <nobr>Wi-Fi System</nobr> better than traditional <nobr>Wi-Fi</nobr> repeaters or other Mesh systems?
block5.reliability-advantage: You can manage your entire network
block5.speed-degradation: of Whole Home solutions for any budget

block6.title: Don’t waste your time and your Internet connection

controller.title: Controller
controller.description-with-wizard:
This Keenetic is in Router Mode and acts as the Controller of your Mesh Wi-Fi System.

To add a new Keenetic device to your Wi-Fi System, switch the new device to Extender Mode, and then connect it to the Controller by simultaneously pressing the 'Wi-Fi' buttons on both devices or using the supplied Ethernet cable. When the new Keenetic appears in the list below, click the Acquire button next to it. The Extender can then be moved to the necessary location to expand your Wi-Fi coverage area.

To switch your Keenetic device to Extender Mode set the operating mode switch on the side or back panel to position C or B (if position C is not available) or use the Web Interface to select Extender Mode.
controller.description-no-wizard:
This Keenetic acts as the Controller of the Mesh Wi-Fi System.

To build the Wi-Fi System, switch a new Keenetic device (Keenetic Buddy devices excepted) to Extender Mode. If the device features a hardware operating mode switch, set it to position C or B; otherwise, use the Web Interface to select Extender Mode. Connect the new Extender to the Controller network either with the supplied Ethernet cable or by pressing the 'Wi-Fi' buttons on both devices. Wait for the Extender tile to appear, click the Acquire button and let the process finish. Then you can move the acquired Extender to the necessary location.

Acquiring the Extender requires it has no admin account password. If you do not see the Extender tile after connecting a new device to your network, or the process fails to finish, reset the new device to the factory default and repeat the procedure.
controller.add: Add an extender to this Wi-Fi System.

band-steering.label: Band Steering
band-steering.tooltip: Band Steering is a technology that detects whether or not the wireless client is dual-band capable, and if it is, it will push the client to connect to the less congested 5 GHz network. Based on the signal level Keenetic will calculate the optimal band for every dual-band wireless client in real time and switch them back-and-forth between 2.4 & 5 GHz networks
band-steering.bottom-description: The names & security settings of the 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Wi-Fi networks must be the same

enable-tx-burst.label: TX Burst
enable-tx-burst.tooltip: Use TX Burst feature to increase the peak data transfer rate from the Keenetic to 802.11 n/ac clients. It always works in home network, but if your ISP's hardware is not compatible with this mode, the Internet speed for Wi-Fi-enabled clients may drop.

256-qam.label: 256-QAM
256-qam.tooltip: Enable this option to increase the connection speed for 802.11n devices that support 256-QAM modulation.

beamforming.label: Beamforming
beamforming.tooltip:
Beamforming technology improves the quality of wireless communication by individually adjusting the transmitted signal for each client.
The checkbox enables the explicit Beamforming mode that formats a multipath Wi-Fi signal based on the feedback from wireless clients.

mu-mimo.label: MU-MIMO
mu-mimo.tooltip: Increases the performance of a wireless network in the corresponding band by simultaneously transmitting data to several wireless clients.

downlink-mu-mimo.label: DL MU-MIMO
downlink-mu-mimo.tooltip: Time-division frame-based multiuser bandwidth control. This feature enables effective simultaneous transmissions to multiple clients.

uplink-mu-mimo.label: UL MU-MIMO
uplink-mu-mimo.tooltip: Enable frame-based coordination for simultaneous transmission from multiple clients.

downlink-ofdma.label: DL OFDMA
downlink-ofdma.tooltip: This technology uses subchannel frequency splitting for data send operations, allowing lower latency and improved download speed in a multi-user environment.

uplink-ofdma.label: UL OFDMA
uplink-ofdma.tooltip: This technology uses subchannel frequency splitting for data receive operations, allowing lower latency and improved upload speed in a multi-user environment.

atf.label: Airtime Fairness
atf.tooltip: Airtime Fairness is a feature that boosts the overall network performance by sacrificing a little bit of airtime of the slowest devices.

atfInbound.label: Inbound
atfInbound.tooltip: Restricts airtime for transferring inbound packets.

twt.label: Target Wake Time
twt.tooltip: Target Wake Time (TWT) is a standby time scheduling introduced for the 802.11ax standard. Its primary goal is to conserve mobile devices' battery power and make the network more efficient by reducing bandwidth use and access contention.

  • – client is not in network.

wifiClient.special-mode-description:
In Range Extender Mode, a Keenetic device can extend your existing wireless coverage by repeating the Wi-Fi signal. At the same time, an extender can also serve as a wireless adapter to connect any wired-only client, such as a game console or Smart TV, to your wireless network. To select a host wireless network, choose the 2.4 GHz or 5 GHz band, and click Scan for a network.
Please note, a wireless connection to a host network is only possible in a single band.

fields.olr-hint:
On-line Reconfiguration

Bit Swapping is an algorithm for maintaining the speed and protecting the line sync against noise bursts by constantly monitoring the carriers usage in Bits Allocation Table, redistributing when needed the available bits from other subchannels and adjusting subchannel gain accordingly.

SRA (Seamless Rate Adaptation) allows for performing the speed adjustment without line resync, for example in the case where actual SNR falls below the set margin. This must be supported on the ISP side to function.

dsl.description: Set up Internet access and supplementary services as per your ISP's directions. Assign the DSL connection as your primary or backup Internet link.

ginp.label: G.INP
ginp.hint: G.INP (defined in ITU-T G.998.4) provides low latency and a minimized overhead retransmission mechanism, to avoid data loss when a high-speed transmission line is affected by impulse noise. In case your ISP does not support this feature, it is advisable to turn the setting off.

g-vector.label: G.Vector
g-vector.hint: Vectoring employs coordination of line signals to reduce the crosstalk levels at the subscriber end (self-FEXT, or internal far-end crosstalk), improving the signal-to-noise ratio and thus general line performance. The standard for this technique is defined by ITU-T G.993.5. Please note that G.Vector requires support from the service provider hardware.

g-vector-non-std.label: Alternative vectoring
g-vector-non-std.hint: In some cases, the operator's hardware Vectoring system requires additional support from customer equipment. Please only enable this option if you know that your service provider uses a non-standard Vectoring implementation.

upbo.label: UPBO
upbo.hint: Upstream Power Back-Off (UPBO) is designed to lower crosstalk interference originating from excessive signal levels. When enabled, your device accepts the Power Spectral Density (PSD) correction for upstream, as evaluated by service provider hardware. In case of frequent line reconnections and/or poor upstream power level, we suggest disabling this feature.

These connections allow access to Internet resources with IPv6 addresses when your ISP uses IPv4 protocol only.

To set up your connection, register with any IPv6 virtual provider (tunnel broker) that uses 6in4 technology. Then click Create connection and enter the IP addresses given by the tunnel broker.

ip46.description: IPv4 over IPv6 provisioning enables legacy IPv4 protocol operation over modern IPv6-only networks. Keenetic automatically detects the options offered by an ISP upon internet connection and creates corresponding configurations if they do not exist. You can also add connections manually if requested by an ISP. Certain connections allow parameter editing, others can be enabled or disabled only.

finish-notice-alert.title: The address of the web interface has changed
finish-notice-alert.router: The Keenetic has been switched to the Router mode. It is now available at http://my.keenetic.net/.
finish-notice-alert.client:
Connecting a Keenetic in Wi-Fi Adapter mode to your home network

  1. Place the Keenetic in Wi-Fi Adapter mode within the coverage of your Wi-Fi network.
  2. Press the Wi-Fi button on the main Keenetic router and the Keenetic in Wi-Fi Adapter mode.
  3. The Internet indicator on the Keenetic in Wi-Fi Adapter mode will light up when connection is successful.
  4. All network ports of the Keenetic in Wi-Fi Adapter mode can be used to connect your home clients.
finish-notice-alert.repeater:
Connecting a Keenetic in Repeater/Extender Mode to your home network

  1. Place the Keenetic in Repeater/Extender Mode at a point within the coverage of your Wi-Fi home network and toward the area you want to get stronger Wi-Fi signal.
  2. Press the Wi-Fi button on the main Keenetic router and the Keenetic in Repeater/Extender Mode.
  3. The Internet indicator on the Repeater/Extender will light up when connection is successful.
  4. Wi-Fi settings will be sent and copied from the main Keenetic, giving you continuous coverage without the need to change the settings of moving connected wireless devices.
  5. All network ports of the Keenetic in Repeater/Extender Mode can be used to connect your home clients.
finish-notice-alert.extender:
Connecting a Keenetic in Extender Mode to your home network

Option I. Wired connection.
  1. A Keenetic in Extender mode can be connected to the main Keenetic using an Ethernet cable and appropriate network ports.
  2. If the connection is successful, the Internet indicator of the Extender will light up.
Option II. Wireless connection.
  1. Place the Keenetic in Extender Mode at a point within the coverage of your Wi-Fi home network and toward the area you want to get stronger Wi-Fi signal.
  2. Press the Wi-Fi button on the main Keenetic device and the Keenetic in Extender Mode.
  3. The Internet indicator on the Extender will light up when connection is successful.
  4. Wi-Fi settings will be sent and copied from the main Keenetic, giving you continuous coverage without the need to change the settings of moving connected wireless clients.
All network ports of the Keenetic in Extender Mode can be used to connect your home clients.
Wireless clients are connected to the Extender using the Wi-Fi network settings specified on the label. You can also change these settings.
finish-notice-alert.ap:
Connecting a Keenetic in Access point/Extender Mode to your home network

  1. A Keenetic in Access point/Extender mode can be connected to the main Keenetic router using an Ethernet cable and appropriate network ports.
  2. If the connection is successful, the Internet indicator of the Access point/Extender will light up.
  3. Wireless clients are connected to the Access point/Extender using the Wi-Fi network settings specified on the label. You can also change these settings.
finish-notice-alert.common:
After changing the operating mode, the web interface of your Keenetic will be available at a new IP address:

  • When connecting to your home network this address is set by the main Keenetic router, and shown on its web interface;
  • When disconnected from your home network, you must use the temporary IP 192.168.1.3. Before you can access this temporary IP you must set your computer IP address somewhere between 192.168.1.4 and 192.168.1.254.
  • Please note that Keenetic has a separate independent configuration file for each operating mode. The administrator password is empty by default, and if set, it is saved independently for each mode.

sandboxes.description: Select the update channel. There are three update channels for KeeneticOS - Main, Preview and Dev. Releases in the Main channel have passed our full rigorous testing and are recommended to all users, to avoid issues and maximize capabilities. Preview channel provides the chance to be among the first to try the latest updates, performance improvements and new features, all with minimal risk. Releases in the Dev channel show what we're working on right now; there are still sometimes bugs present, as we want you, our community, to share in what's new as soon as possible. Your input is really valued.

stable.description-short-text: This channel is fully tested & is recommended for most users.

It is updated roughly every two weeks, with major updates about every two months. Releases here are typically more than a month in advance of release to the general audience in the Main Channel.

diagnostics.header-sub-title: Use this menu to collect system self-diagnostic files, check connections to network hosts, and view system log events. It is also possible to capture network traffic after installing the necessary component.

connections.title: Active Connections

log.system-messages-list: The system journal keeps event records from when the device boots up. You can view the events and set up automatic forwarding of the log records to a Syslog server.

notification.disable-send-to-server: Sending to an external server is forbidden

capture.header-info: You can enable capture of network traffic going through the selected interface of your Keenetic. The generated file may be opened for analysis on a PC using the Wireshark program.

edit.header-info: Select the network interface on which you want to listen to the traffic, and specify the parameters for the packet capture.
edit.filter-help:
Apply filters to reduce the amount of captured traffic and save the memory space for the data that interests you. The filter syntax is the same as in {{wiresharkLink}}. 
Example: with the filter '{{wiresharkExample}}' only DNS traffic to IP {{wiresharkExampleIp}} will be captured.
edit.promisc-help: Turn on so the interface does not discard traffic that is not addressed to it.

capture.delete-confirm: Packet capture rule will be deleted
capture.flush-confirm: All packet capture settings will be deleted

debugger.header-info:
Entering the debug mode will restart selected services to enable collection of comprehensive information to the system journal. Starting and stopping debug mode momentarily interrupts any connections to the device.
When the debug process is stopping, the system self-test file is collected automatically. You can also save self-test files manually in the middle of the debug process via the General tab.
The debug mode should only be used when instructed explicitly by a technical support team engineer.
debugger.preparing-file-caption: The file is being prepared for saving
debugger.self-test-description: KeeneticOS will perform its current status tests and compile a diagnostic file, available for you to save and convey to technical support.

usbdsl-dumpsoc.description:
Diagnostics helps support engineers in troubleshooting the DSL connection. 
It is a 10 minute process resulting in a file that should be sent to Keenetic Support for analysis.
usbdsl-dumpsoc.status-in-progress: DSL modem diagnostics is in progress

error.cancelled: Diagnostics was aborted due to reconfiguration of the interface
error.timed_out: Diagnostics was aborted by timeout. Please try again.
error.interrupted: Diagnostics was aborted due to system shutdown

usbdsl-statistics.description: Allows you to evaluate the quality of your DSL line.

line-statistics-report.description: Every minute this report saves 32 major DSL connection parameters. Historical data is kept for the most recent 24 hours, presenting a summary of events that happened on your DSL line.

line-performance-report.description: Initiate this report in case the DSL connection speed is slower than expected or Keenetic cannot establish a DSL connection at all. The test will take around seven minutes. You can then submit the resulting file for analysis by a support engineer, as per request. Please note that this report is not available while the line disconnect report is active.
line-performance-report.delete-confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the compiled report?
line-performance-report.diagnostics-failed: One of the DSL diagnostic stages failed. See details in the {{logLinkOpen}}{{logTitle}}{{logLinkClose}}.

line-disconnect-report.description: This report collects detailed data to help identify the DSL line disconnection reason. Data is collected at the time of the disconnection and later dispatched to the Keenetic technical support team automatically. Please contact Keenetic support before enabling this report. To enable the report, please allow sharing of device usage information in the {{settingsLinkOpen}}System settings{{settingsLinkClose}} menu, under Product Improvement Program.

line-disconnect-report.delete-confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the disconnection report?

submit-status.submitted: Last report submitted to support: {{filename}} ({{date}} at {{time}})

cable-diagnostics.description:
Display the results of a time domain reflectometry (TDR) diagnostic test run on an interface.
A TDR test characterizes and locates faults on twisted-pair Ethernet cables. For example, it can detect a broken twisted pair and provide the approximate distance to the break.
Select the port and press the Test button.

NORMAL.label: Normal
NORMAL.description: No cable fault detected for the twisted pair.

OPEN.label: Open
OPEN.description: Lack of continuity between the pins of the twisted-pair.

SHORT.label: Short
SHORT.description: A short-circuit was detected on the twisted pair.

IMPEDANCE_MISMATCH.label: Impedance mismatch
IMPEDANCE_MISMATCH.description: Impedance on the twisted pair is not correct. Possible reasons for an impedance mismatch include: The twisted pair is not connected properly; the twisted pair is damaged; the connector is faulty.

LINE_DRIVER.label: Line driver
LINE_DRIVER.description: The twisted pair connects to a powered-off terminal, for example, a disabled or malfunctioning port on a powered-on client. Generally, there is no problem with the cable.

distance.label: Distance
distance.description: Distance to the fault in whole meters. If there is no fault, this value is 0.

vpn-ikev2.popup-description:
The IKEv2/IPsec VPN server allows authorized users to connect to your home network resources over the Internet, using a secure and robust tunneling protocol.
IKEv2/IPsec client is available out-of-the-box in modern releases of Windows, MacOS and iOS operating systems, and most Linux distributions. Please select the authentication type 'username' when setting up a client connection.

optimization-mode.label: Optimization mode
optimization-mode.help-hint:
The legacy mode enables 3DES/DES encryption and is advisable only when a client with an older operating system cannot establish a connection.
Maximum performance mode takes advantage of CHACHA20-POLY1305 (supported in KeeneticOS and Android/Strongswan) for a secure, high-speed connection.

Please confirm turning off the connection.
You may lose remote access to the device.

description.label: Provider name
description.comment: You may rename this connection at your will.

connection-type.label: Connection type
connection-type.hint:
Always on connections carry service traffic even when not in use. This ensures seamless switching in the event of a connection failure.
To start the backup connection only when the higher priority connections fail, select the On demand type.

ttl-modification.label: Modify TTL
ttl-modification.hint: Adjusting the TTL value inhibits NAT processing acceleration for this interface and may thus induce decreased data transfer speed.

iface-ppp.hint-message: Please type in your full username and password, exactly as supplied by your service provider.

ipv6.hint: To manually configure IPv6, you must provide the value and length (bit mask) for the IPv6 address and IPv6 prefix. The IPv6 prefix specifies the range of addresses available for assignment to your local clients. The Default IPv6 gateway should always fall within the subnet defined by the IPv6 address.

ignore-remote-dns.label: Ignore DNSv6 from ISP
ignore-remote-dns.hint: This option turns off using the IPv6 DNS servers provided automatically via this connection.

ignore-remote-dns.label: Ignore DNSv4 from ISP
ignore-remote-dns.hint: This option turns off using the IPv4 DNS servers provided automatically via this connection.

iface-ip.inbound-ttl-hint: Set the Time To Live in seconds for the incoming packets. Adjusting the TTL value inhibits NAT processing acceleration for this interface and may thus induce decreased data transfer speed in both directions.
iface-ip.outbound-ttl-hint: Set the Time To Live in seconds for the outgoing packets. Adjusting the TTL value inhibits NAT processing acceleration for this interface and may thus induce decreased data transfer speed in both directions.
iface-ip.ignore-dns-hint: Tick this checkbox to ignore DNS servers automatically received for this connection.
iface-ip.ipv6-ndw4-link: Further IPv6 settings are available in the {{ndw4LinkOpen}}new interface{{ndw4LinkClose}} with updates via the Dev channel.

ipv6-over-ipv4-provisioning.hint: Your Keenetic automatically detects IPv4 over IPv6 provisioning options offered by your ISP. Usually, no configuration is necessary on the subscriber side. Still, you can manually adjust any detected options.

iface-ip.map-t-hint: MAP-T employs a special network translation mechanism to allow access to IPv4 sites over IPv6-only connections. Please check whether your ISP supports this feature.
